description: Set the value of ball attributes. This command is a synonym for the ball initialize command. Ball attributes are characteristics of the balls such as position or size. These are distinct from ball properties (assigned with the ball property command) that are surface properties of the balls that are used to fill contact model properties.

modifiers.name: gradient
modifiers.description: Apply linear gradient in each axis direction starting at origin

modifiers.name: gradient-x/y/z
modifiers.description: Apply linear gradient in specific direction

examples.description: Set density to 1000 and damping coefficient to 0.7 for all balls (most common usage)
Set initial velocity for balls in specified position range
Apply constant force to balls in group (not updated during cycling)

examples.command: ball attribute radius 0.5 multiply 1.2 range id 1 100
examples.description: Multiply radius by 1.2 for balls with ID 1-100 (use model clean after geometry changes)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: Use Ball.set_*() methods (e.g., Ball.set_density(), Ball.set_vel(), Ball.set_pos()) - requires iteration over ball range
